title: How to Make a Network Connection Private in Windows 10

steps.headline: Open the Settings app.
steps.description:
Click the Start {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/0/07/Windowsstart.png","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/0/07/Windowsstart.png/30px-Windowsstart.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":460,"bigWidth":"30","bigHeight":"30","licensing":"

"} gear.

steps.headline: Go to the Network & Internet category.
Go to your network type.
steps.description: Click either Wi-Fi or Ethernet from the left pane.

steps.headline: Open the properties of the current connection.
steps.description: Click the name of the current network box in the center portion of the window.

steps.headline: Change the network profile to private.
steps.description: Click the "Private" radio button under the "Network profile" header.

steps.headline: Make your PC discoverable.
steps.description:
Toggle on {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/0\/0a\/Windows10switchon.png","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/0\/0a\/Windows10switchon.png\/57px-Windows10switchon.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":218,"bigWidth":"57","bigHeight":"27","licensing":"

License: Public Domain<\/a>
\n<\/p><\/div>"} the switch under the "Make this PC discoverable" header. Doing so will change your connection type to private.

Using Settings (Version 1709 and Newer) Open the Settings app. Click the Start {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/0/07/Windowsstart.png","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/0/07/Windowsstart.png/30px-Windowsstart.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":460,"bigWidth":"30","bigHeight":"30","licensing":"

"} gear. Go to the Network & Internet category. Go to your network type. Click either Wi-Fi or Ethernet from the left pane. Open the properties of the current connection. Click the name of the current network box in the center portion of the window. Change the network profile to private. Click the "Private" radio button under the "Network profile" header. sentences: Using Settings (Version 1709 and Newer) Open the Settings app.

Click the Start {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/0/07/Windowsstart.png","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/0/07/Windowsstart.png/30px-Windowsstart.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":460,"bigWidth":"30","bigHeight":"30","licensing":"

"} gear.
Go to the Network & Internet category.
Click either Wi-Fi or Ethernet from the left pane.
Open the properties of the current connection.
Click the name of the current network box in the center portion of the window.
Change the network profile to private.
Click the "Private" radio button under the "Network profile" header.
Using Settings (Version 1703 and Older) Open the Settings app.

Go to the Network & Internet category.
Click either Wi-Fi or Ethernet from the left pane.

Click the name of the current network box in the center portion of the window.
